description.narrative: Offering tailored negotiation skills training for humanitarian aid workers working both at field level and headquarters. Clingendael training sessions help participants to develop a reliable set of negotiation skills, in order to increase the chance of gaining access to persons in need and population in conflict.
Participants have gained humanitarian negotiation skills and knowledge and are actively implementing this knowledge in their work.

We train: 1. staff of headquarter level and regional office level (strategic level, strengthening institutional capacity) 2. Humanitarian aid workers in the field on operational and frontline level (sharing best practices and lessons learned). 3. Humanitarian mediators, a seperate group, who have the trust of both the warring party and humanitarian actors.

title.narrative: Sufficient trainings are provided to relevant staff at HQ and in the field
At least 80% of participants is from relevant department/works in humanitarian negotiations

description.narrative: 100% of the participants were from relevant departments or was working with a humanitarian organisation and at times involved in negotiations.

title.narrative: At least 80% of participants rated the training received as useful in their current or anticipated work

description.narrative: 100% of the respondents indicated that they found the training useful for their work.

title.narrative: Participants feel more confident in leading and participating in negotiation processes
At least 75% expects to implement gained knowledge and skills in their work

description.narrative: 100% of the respondents indicated to have gained knowledge and skills.

title.narrative: At least 60% feels very confident in their ability to lead a negotiation process or to support field staff in negotiations

description.narrative: 60% of the respondents indicate they feel confident in supporting field staff, while 40% feels very confident. 60% feels confident in leading a negotioation process. The other 40% feel neutral about taking the lead.

title.narrative: At least 60% of relevant participants feels confident in their ability to provide negotiation training to peers.

description.narrative: There is no relevant data available from this training.

title.narrative: Participants have gained humanitarian negotiation skills and knowledge and are actively implementing this knowledge in their work
At least 75% can select and practically implement the following key tools: humanitarian negotiation sheet and conflict analysis tool.

description.narrative: All of the respondents indicate knowledge of the tools and how to use them. 80% indicated they have used or will be using elements of the negotiation sheet and/or conflict analysis tool

title.narrative: At least 75% have increased their knowledge of humanitarian negotiating techniques and methods.

description.narrative: Almost 30% of the participants provided information after the training. All of them indicated an increase in knowledge of negotiation techniques.
